Company: Ashland Hospital Corp. d/b/a King's Daughters Medical Center
Description: Ashland Hospital Corp. d/b/a King's Daughters Medical Center agreed to pay $40.9 million to resolve allegations that it submitted false claims to the Medicare and Kentucky Medicaid programs for medically unnecessary coronary stents and diagnostic catheterizations and had prohibited financial relationships with physicians referring patients to the hospital.

Company: Ashland Hospital Corporation d/b/a King's Daughters Medical Center
Description: The Department of Justice reached 70 settlements involving 457 hospitals in 43 states for more than $250 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.
back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: King's Daughters Medical Center agreed to pay $40.9 million in settlement of allegations it falsely billed federal health care programs for heart procedures performed on patients who did not need them.The state's share of recovered Medicaid funds was $1,018,380. The settlement was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/ky-kings-daughters-medical-center-0
